intro: Securidaca mollis, commonly known as sweet woodruff, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, fragrant foliage. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic properties. Securidaca mollis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
